items

Class ItemInventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • items.ItemInventory

  • public class ItemInventory
extends java.lang.Object
    ItemInventory is used for storage of all items available to the player.

    This includes weapons and shields, as well as the letters, keys, and the torch available to the player.

    Changes: The class now supports proper interchange between items given, and existing items.

    Total Time Spent: 2 hour(s).

    Version:
    2.0.0.0
    Author:
    Lev Raizman

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Item> items
      All the items available to the player.
      private int keys
      The amount of keys the player has.
      private int[] letters
      The letters the player has already found.
      private boolean torch
      Whether or not the player has a torch.

        public void addItem(Item m)
        Adds an Item to the ItemInventory if it is not full, or replaces the last Item if full.

      • addLetter

        public void addLetter(char letter)
        Adds a letter to the letter array, and increments the amount of letters.
        Parameters:
        letter - the letter to be added.

      • getLetters

        public java.lang.String getLetters()
        Returns:
        The letters the user has found, in the order they were found.

      • switchWith

        public Item switchWith(Item newItem,
                       int pos)
        Sets the Item at pos to newItem and returns the previously stored value.
        Parameters:
        newItem - Item being added.
        pos - position for Item to be added to.
        Returns:
        The Item previously at pos.

      • increaseInVision

        public int increaseInVision()
        The sum of vision of the player. The torch gives one vision, and the Fulvus Lance gives another.
        Returns:
        The radius of player vision.

      • getKey

        public boolean getKey()
        If a key exists, decrements amount of keys and returns true.
        Returns:
        Whether there previously was a key.

      • getKeys

        public int getKeys()
        Returns:
        The amount of keys the player has.

      • getTorch

        public boolean getTorch()
        Returns:
        Whether the user has a torch or not.

      • getItems

        Returns:
